intro: Melanthium ciliatum, commonly known as the silky false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the bellflower family (Campanulaceae) and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are elongated and have a distinctive silky texture along the edges. Melanthium ciliatum is often found in clusters, with multiple flowering stems rising from a single rosette of basal leaves.
